item.dc:creator: @asdjf asdjf
item.description:
@asdjf wrote:

hey thanks for this it works great! however…

i managed to edit some .PNG’s in the cache, but when i tried to edit the crowns [because my mod crown is a donor crown] it failed…

http://btkscape.com/Play

it worked when i used your cache, btu as soon as i edited the crowns it failed…

Read full topic

item.title: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)
item.dc:creator: @hitscape hitscape
item.description:
@hitscape wrote:

I got an error for my webclient !

ERROR : java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Exception: java.lang.ClassFormatError: Incompatible magic value 1008813135 in class file client
load: class client.class not found.
java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source)
at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source)
Caused by: java.io.IOException: Stream closed.
at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.available(Unknown Source)
at java.net.SocketInputStream.available(Unknown Source)
at java.io.BufferedInputStream.available(Unknown Source)
at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAheadNonBlocking(Unknown Source)
at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAhead(Unknown Source)
at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.available(Unknown Source)
at sun.net.www.MeteredStream.available(Unknown Source)
at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source)
at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source)
at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)
… 7 more
Exception: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

  • i cant login on the server on my comp and i got no source… where i download a source ? can u give me a link pls …

and i give u rep++

Read full topic
item.source: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)

item.title: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

[quote=“Praktikanten, post:12, topic:335848”]It was the code line from Ric’s Tutorial that messed things up!
I removed it and now it works perfect!
Thank you loads for helping me, you will be credited when I release my server :D[/quote]

Thank you for giving me credit, I appreciate it. And I’m very glad I helped you!

Read full topic

item.title: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

I’m not sure about the first code you used, but the second code (from my tutorial) is an HTML code for Java Applets/Webclients. Did you put the codes next to one another? If so delete one of them and only use one.

Honestly I have no idea why your getting that error.

Read full topic
item.source: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)

item.title: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)
item.dc:creator: @Praktikanten Praktikanten
item.description:
@Praktikanten wrote:

[quote=“Halflingblade, post:9, topic:335848”][quote author=Praktikanten link=topic=432229.msg3173181#msg3173181 date=1270593648]

Great guide

I have a problem though…
I’ve followed your guide and I’ve got the finished client.jar file. When I run it on my computer it works perfect, it downloads and unpacks cache fine and I’m able to login and such. But on my website I get a white screen with a red cross with the following error code:

inläsning: klassen client.class finns inte. (In english this means something like: "reading: the class client.class does not exist.") java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: Stream closed. at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.available(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAheadNonBlocking(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAhead(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.MeteredStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) ... 7 more Undantag: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
Can you help me with this?

I’ll be glad to help.
Are you sure you uploaded client.jar to the main folder of your web host?

Well uhh, I’m not really sure about what you mean by web host? Is it like freewebs (where my website is at)?

Yes, all you have to do on freewebs is login, click file manager, single file uploader, and upload your client.jar file. Hope that helped.

I uploaded the client.jar to the main folder now (no folder) and removed the old one, but I still get the same error code
[/quote]

Thats very odd. I’ve never gotten this error before, I’ve gotten an error like it.

Thats just because I forgot to Sign my jar file after Jarring it.

It could also mean that you didn’t use the right HTML code. Make sure the letters in your client.jar file are all lowercase and not something like Client.jar.

Try those, if you still have problems I can look it up for you.[/quote]

Well, is used the freewebs app Custom HTML and added this code:

[code]

Durvoscape Web Client
//This line I have from Ric’s Webclient Tutorial, I don’t know if I really should keep it here?

<applet name="durvoscape" width="765" height="503" archive="client.jar" code="client.class">
<param name="java_arguments" value="-Xmx1024m">
</applet>

</BODY>
</HTML>[/code]

Read full topic
item.source: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)

item.title: Halflingblade's Open Webclient (Ready for Jarring, Signing, and Uploading!)
item.dc:creator: @Halflingblade Halflingblade
item.description:
@Halflingblade wrote:

[quote=“Praktikanten, post:8, topic:335848”][quote author=Halflingblade link=topic=432229.msg3173177#msg3173177 date=1270593490]

Great guide

I have a problem though…
I’ve followed your guide and I’ve got the finished client.jar file. When I run it on my computer it works perfect, it downloads and unpacks cache fine and I’m able to login and such. But on my website I get a white screen with a red cross with the following error code:

inläsning: klassen client.class finns inte. (In english this means something like: "reading: the class client.class does not exist.") java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: Stream closed. at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.available(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAheadNonBlocking(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAhead(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.MeteredStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) ... 7 more Undantag: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class
Can you help me with this?

I’ll be glad to help.
Are you sure you uploaded client.jar to the main folder of your web host?

Well uhh, I’m not really sure about what you mean by web host? Is it like freewebs (where my website is at)?

Yes, all you have to do on freewebs is login, click file manager, single file uploader, and upload your client.jar file. Hope that helped.
[/quote]

I uploaded the client.jar to the main folder now (no folder) and removed the old one, but I still get the same error code :/[/quote]

Thats very odd. I’ve never gotten this error before, I’ve gotten an error like it.

Thats just because I forgot to Sign my jar file after Jarring it.

It could also mean that you didn’t use the right HTML code. Make sure the letters in your client.jar file are all lowercase and not something like Client.jar.

Try those, if you still have problems I can look it up for you.

Read full topic

Can you help me with this?

I’ll be glad to help.
Are you sure you uploaded client.jar to the main folder of your web host?

Well uhh, I’m not really sure about what you mean by web host? Is it like freewebs (where my website is at)?
[/quote]

Yes, all you have to do on freewebs is login, click file manager, single file uploader, and upload your client.jar file. Hope that helped.[/quote]

I uploaded the client.jar to the main folder now (no folder) and removed the old one, but I still get the same error code

inläsning: klassen client.class finns inte. (In english this means something like: "reading: the class client.class does not exist.") java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2ClassLoader.loadCode(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager.createApplet(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Plugin2Manager$AppletExecutionRunnable.run(Unknown Source) at java.lang.Thread.run(Unknown Source) Caused by: java.io.IOException: Stream closed. at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.available(Unknown Source) at java.net.SocketInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAheadNonBlocking(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.readAhead(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.http.ChunkedInputStream.available(Unknown Source) at sun.net.www.MeteredStream.available(Unknown Source) at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.getBytes(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader.access$000(Unknown Source) at sun.plugin2.applet.Applet2ClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) ... 7 more Undantag: java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: client.class

inläsning: klassen client.class finns inte.
